content.text:
# List of international presidential trips made by Egils Levits

During his time in office (July 2019-2023), Egils Levits made numerous international trips in his capacity as the president of Latvia.
Number of trips to each country
* One: Austria, Azerbaijan, Denmark, Finland, Japan, Lithuania, Poland, Slovakia, Spain and Switzerland
* Two: Estonia, Germany and Sweden
* Three: Belgium and United Kingdom
* Four: Ukraine and United States
2019
{| class="wikitable sortable" style="margin: 1em auto 1em auto"
|-
! Country
! Areas visited
! Dates
! Details
! Image
|-
|
|Tallinn
|10 July
|First official visit. Met with President Kersti Kaljulaid and Prime Minister Jüri Ratas.
|
|-
|
|Helsinki
|28 August
|Working visit. Discussion of bilateral relations with President Sauli Niinistö.
|
|-
|
|New York City
|22–26 September
|Attended General debate of the seventy-fourth session of the United Nations General Assembly
|
|-
|
|Tokyo
|21–24 October
|Enthronement of Japanese Emperor Naruhito
|
|-
|
|Brussels
|25 November
|Visit to NATO Headquarters; meeting with Secretary General Jens Stoltenberg.
|
|-
|
|London
|3–4 December
|See 2019 London summit
|
|-
|}
2020
{| class="wikitable sortable" style="margin: 1em auto 1em auto"
|-
! Country
! Areas visited
! Dates
! Details
! Image
|-
|
|Geneva
|20 January
|Visit to the European Organization for Nuclear Research (CERN).
|
|-
|
|New York
|22-26 September
|Attended the General debate of the seventy-fifth session of the United Nations General Assembly. During his visit, he also held meetings with UN Secretary-General António Guterres and other world leaders. He also spoke at the UN Sustainable Development Summit, where he addressed issues of international law, the rule of law, climate, and digital challenges.
|
|}
2021
{| class="wikitable sortable" style="margin: 1em auto 1em auto"
|-
! Country
! Areas visited
! Dates
! Details
! Image
|-
|
|Brussels
|13–14 June
|Levits travelled to Brussels to attend the 31st NATO summit.
|
|-
|
|Stockholm
|20-22 June
|Met with King Carl XVI Gustav of Sweden, country’s officials, business owners, higher education, science and culture representatives. Official visit to mark the 100th anniversary of diplomatic relations and the 30th anniversary of the restoration of Latvia's independence.
|
|-
|
|Vienna
|30 June–2 July
|Participation in the "Austrian World Summit 2021"; meeting with President Alexander Van der Bellen.
|
|-
|
|Kyiv
|23–24 August
|Attended Crimea Platform and Kyiv Independence Day Parade
|
|-
|
|New York City
|20–23 September
|Attended General debate of the seventy-sixth session of the United Nations General Assembly.
|
|-
|
|Copenhagen
|12-13 October
|
|
|-
|
|Malmö
|13 October
|Attended the Malmö International Forum on Holocaust Remembrance and Combating Antisemitism.
|
|-
|
|Tartu
|5 November
|Meeting with new Estonian President Alar Karis
|
|-
|
|Vilnius
|15 November
|Met with Estonian President Alar Karis and Lithuanian President Gitanas Nausėda.
|
|}
2022
{| class="wikitable sortable" style="margin: 1em auto 1em auto"
|-
! Country
! Areas visited
! Dates
! Details
! Image
|-
|
|Munich
|19 February
|Attended the Munich Security Conference. Also met with Chancellor Olaf Scholz, Estonian Prime Minister Kaja Kallas, British Prime Minister Boris Johnson and Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy.
|
|-
|
|Brussels
|23-24 March
|Levits travelled to Brussels to attend the extraordinary NATO summit to discuss the Russian invasion of Ukraine.
|
|-
|
| Kyiv
| 13 April
|Met with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy, Polish President Andrzej Duda, Lithuanian President Gitanas Nausėda, Estonian President Alar Karis
|
|-
|
|Bucharest
|10 June
|Attended Bucharest Nine Summit.
|
|-
|
|Madrid
|28–30 June
|Attendance to the 32nd NATO summit.
|
|-
|
| Kyiv
| 9 September
|Met with the Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy and Polish Prime Minister Mateusz Morawiecki
|
|-
|
| London
|18–19 September
| Attendance to the state funeral of Elizabeth II
|
|-
|
|New York City
|20-26 September
|Attended General debate of the seventy-seventh session of the United Nations General Assembly
|
|}

| Munich
|17–18 February
| Meeting of the Munich Security Conference, talks with President Emmanuel Macron, President Gitanas Nausėda and Prime Minister Kaja Kallas
|
|-
|
| Warsaw
|23 February
| Extraordinary Summit of the Bucharest Nine due to the Ukraine conflict, talks with President Joe Biden
|
|-
|
| Lviv
| 3 March
|
|
|-
|
| Baku
| 8–9 March
|Official visit; meetings with President Ilham Aliyev; participation in the opening of the 10th Baku Global Forum.
|
|-
|
| Lisbon
| 11–14 April
|State visit; meetings with Portuguese President Marcelo Rebelo de Sousa and other officials; signing of memorandums of cooperation in science and culture.
|
|-
|
| London
|6–7 May
| Attendance to the Coronation of King Charles III
|
|-
|
| Bratislava
|6–7 June
| Meeting with NATO leaders and talks with Secretary-General Jens Stoltenberg. Attended Bucharest Nine Summit.
|
|}
